title: Citi Economic Pulse Survey: Californians Enjoy a Shift in Financial Mindset; More than Half Comfortable with Personal Savings and Debt Levels
summary: San Francisco - Wrapping up 2012 and looking to the New Year, residents of the Golden State are feeling better about their personal finances and the state economy, according to the latest Citi Economic Pulse survey.
tag-1: Citi Economic Pulse Survey: Californians Enjoy a Shift in Financial Mindset; More than Half Comfortable with Personal Savings and Debt Levels
tag-3: San Francisco – Wrapping up 2012 and looking to the New Year, residents of the Golden State are feeling better about their personal finances and the state economy, according to the latest Citi Economic Pulse survey.
tag-4: According to the survey, which focuses on California consumer sentiment in the current and future economic environment, 66 percent of Californians are optimistic that their personal financial situation will be better off in the coming year. This includes a record high of 21 percent saying they are very optimistic that their finances will improve.
tag-5: "It is encouraging to see that Californians have positive expectations for both their own financial situation and the state economy," said Rebecca Macieira-Kaufmann, President of Citibank California. "We have seen historically that as residents feel improvement in the economy, they begin to feel more confident about spending. This, in turn, could mean positive movement for the California economy."
tag-6: More than half of respondents (56 percent) expect the state economy to improve in 2013. Of that, 10 percent believe that business conditions in California will be much better in the coming year, the highest point measured since the question was first asked in this survey series in September of 2009.
tag-7: Savings and Spending The survey shows that Californians are feeling confident about their personal finances, with nearly half (49 percent) saying they are somewhat to very comfortable with their current level of savings and 40 percent meeting their month-to-month savings goal. Sixty-one percent are somewhat to very comfortable with their current level of debt (i.e., mortgage or loans). In terms of spending, 35 percent said they spent more money in 2012 than in 2011, and 35 percent said their spending was the same year-over-year.
tag-8: With this positive shift, consumers are more willing to spend, especially around the holidays. According to the survey:
tag-9: Regional Differences The latest survey again found significant differences between Southern and Northern California, particularly in the San Francisco Area, where residents are much more confident than the rest of the state.
tag-10: Citi Economic Pulse in California  The Citi Economic Pulse in California rose six points since the same period last year. Statewide the Pulse sits at negative-10 -- up from negative-16 in November 2011.
tag-12: When asked about New Year's financial resolutions, Californians have plans that include: saving more money (24 percent), earning more money (19 percent), and having less debt (15 percent).
tag-13: "These results show that Californians are turning a corner and moving forward," said Macieira-Kaufmann. "It's encouraging to see optimism on the rise."
